  1. Madison News

    Stay up to date with the city

  1. Mowing Right of Ways

    The City of Madison is currently reestablishing contracts with a landscaping company to care for City right of ways. We ask residents to please be patient with overgrown grass while paperwork is finalized soon. Keeping Madison beautiful is a top priority. Read on...

  2. Public Storm Shelter List

    Madison now offers a public storm shelter in City limits at the Madison Church of Christ located at 556 Hughes Road. Read on for more storm shelter information. Read on...

  3. FEMA Revises Floodplain Map

    FEMA has issued a Letter of Map Revision for the floodplain behind the Home Place subdivision that removes all the homes from the flood hazard zone and they will no longer be required to carry flood insurance. Read on...

  4. Singing River Trail Master Plan Workshops Scheduled

    Draft Plan Workshops Feb 5 & 6: The Singing River Trail is a 70-mile trail vision for North Alabama. The trail would bring recreation, transportation, healthy living and economic development opportunities to the region. Read on...

  5. Madison Named "Best Place to Live in Alabama"

    The City of Madison has earned the “Best Place to Live in Alabama” title. According to Niche.com‘s rankings, Madison scored an A+ in categories including Public Schools, Housing and Good for Families. Our City also scored an A Diversity and Jobs. Read on...

  6. Road Resurfacing

    The City of Madison would like to inform residents that as of Monday April 15, 2019 road resurfacing will begin on Firestone Drive and Laura Drive. Read on...

  7. Multi-Use Venue Market Study and Letter from the Mayor

    Get more information regarding the Market Research presentation and a letter from Mayor Finley to Madison residents. Read More
View All
